source: Music education research and proven pedagogical methods

lullaby.name: Lullaby / Sleep Song
lullaby.purpose: Calming, sleep induction, bedtime routine, bonding

musicalCharacteristics.dynamics: pp to mp (very soft to moderately soft)
musicalCharacteristics.keyMood: Major keys for comfort, minor keys for melancholy beauty

sections.description: Introduce sleep theme, child's name, comforting imagery
sections.example:
[Name], [Name], close your eyes
Stars are twinkling in the skies
[Name] is safe and warm tonight
Drifting off in soft moonlight

Sleep, sweet [Name], sleep so deep
Angels guard you while you sleep
Dreams of love will come your way
Until the morning brings new day

[Name], [Name], rest your head
Soft and cozy in your bed
[Name] is loved beyond compare
Mommy/Daddy's always there

sections.description: Repeat for familiarity and calming effect

sections.example:
[Name], [Name], drift away
Tomorrow brings another day
Goodnight, sweet [Name], sleep tight

lullaby.scientificBasis: 60-80 BPM matches resting heartbeat, activates parasympathetic nervous system, releases oxytocin (bonding hormone)

educational.name: Educational / Learning Song
educational.purpose: Teaching concepts, vocabulary building, cognitive development

musicalCharacteristics.dynamics: mf to f (moderately loud to loud)
musicalCharacteristics.articulation: Staccato mixed with legato (bouncy and smooth)

sections.description: Upbeat instrumental, sets learning mood (8 beats)

sections.example:
[Name], [Name], let's learn today
Colors, numbers, fun to say!
[Name] is smart and growing bright
Learning things feels just right!

Are you ready? Yes, I am!
Let's start learning, here we go, bam!

A-B-C with [Name] today
D-E-F, we sing and play
G-H-I-J-K-L-M
[Name] knows the alphabet, yes!

[Name], [Name], you did great
Learning more, we celebrate!
[Name] can count from one to ten
Let's try it out again!

[Name] is a learner, strong and true
Every day there's something new
You can do it, yes you can!

[Name] learned so much today
Good job, [Name], hip-hip-hooray!

structureTemplate.educationalIntegration: Embed learning content in chorus, use call-and-response

educational.scientificBasis: Music activates multiple brain regions simultaneously, songs improve memory retention by 60-80% vs. spoken word

energizing.name: Energizing / Movement Song
energizing.purpose: Physical activity, mood boosting, transitions, exercise

musicalCharacteristics.dynamics: f to ff (loud to very loud)

sections.lyricStyle: Counting down or 'Ready, set, go!' cue

sections.example:
[Name], [Name], jump up high! [*JUMP*]
Reach your hands up to the sky! [*REACH*]
[Name] has energy to share
Moving, grooving everywhere!

sections.description: Clear movement instructions with sound effects
sections.example:
Clap your hands [*CLAP CLAP*], stomp your feet [*STOMP*]
Spin around to the beat [*SPIN*]
[Name], [Name], dance with me
Move your body, wild and free!

[Name], [Name], wiggle and shake [*SHAKE*]
Move like a snake, for goodness' sake!
Jump like a frog [*BOING*], roar like a bear [*ROAR*]
[Name]'s having fun everywhere!

And FREEZE! [*silence*] Good job, [Name]!
Ready to dance again? Let's GO!

Great job, [Name], you moved so well
Take a deep breath... [*inhale/exhale*]

structureTemplate.movementIntegration: Explicit action cues in brackets, simple choreography

energizing.scientificBasis: Physical movement + music enhances motor development, rhythm processing linked to executive function

affirmation.name: Positive Affirmation Song
affirmation.purpose: Self-esteem building, identity formation, emotional regulation

musicalCharacteristics.tempoName: Andante to Moderato (walking pace to moderate)
musicalCharacteristics.articulation: Legato with strong emphasis on affirmations

sections.lyricStyle: Optional spoken intro: 'Listen to these words, [Name]...'

sections.description: Who the child is, their uniqueness
sections.example:
[Name], [Name], you are special
Unique and wonderful, yes you are
[Name], you are loved beyond measure
You're our shining, bright star

I am brave, I am strong (I am brave, I am strong)
I am kind, I belong (I am kind, I belong)
I can do hard things, it's true
I believe in me, yes I do!

[Name], [Name], you are learning
Every day your mind is growing
[Name], mistakes help you get better
You keep trying, always knowing

My feelings are okay to feel
My ideas are important and real
[Name], you make a difference
You matter, your presence is a gift

[Name], remember these words are true
I am proud to be me, through and through
I am [Name], and I am enough

structureTemplate.affirmationStyle: Mix second-person ([Name], you are...) and first-person (I am...) for ownership

affirmation.scientificBasis: Positive affirmations activate reward centers in brain, first-person statements 2x more effective for internalization (ages 3+)

story.name: Story / Narrative Song
story.purpose: Teaching through storytelling, moral lessons, imagination

musicalCharacteristics.tempoName: Andante to Moderato (varies with story pacing)
musicalCharacteristics.dynamics: Variable (mp to f depending on story action)
musicalCharacteristics.articulation: Varied (legato for calm, staccato for action)

sections.example:
Once upon a time there lived
A child named [Name] so bright
[Name] had a special gift
Of spreading joy and light

[Name] loved to explore and play
Adventures every single day
One morning [Name] woke up and found
Something magical on the ground

[Name], [Name], brave and true
Wonderful things are waiting for you
[Name], [Name], use your heart
Every ending's a new start

[Name] met a friend who felt so sad
Lost their toy, they felt so bad
[Name] said, 'Don't worry, I'll help you'
Working together, that's what we'll do!

They searched high and low with care
Helping hands were everywhere
[Name] showed that kindness wins
That's where happiness begins

And so [Name] learned that day
Helping others is the way
[Name], you can be a hero too
Kindness starts with you

structureTemplate.storyElements: Characters, setting, conflict, resolution, moral - adapted to age level

story.scientificBasis: Narrative structure activates episodic memory, emotional engagement improves retention, moral reasoning develops through stories

seasonal.name: Seasonal / Holiday Song

sections.example:
[Holiday] is here, [Name] can't wait
Time to celebrate, it feels so great!
[Name] sees the [holiday symbols]
Love and joy fill up our home

[Name], [Name], it's [holiday] time
Let's sing together, bells will chime
[Name], [Name], hearts are bright
Celebrate with all our might!

[Name] helps with [holiday activity]
Family together, joy and unity
[Name] learns about [cultural element]
Traditions shared from heart

[Holiday] teaches us to [core value]
[Name], you are part of this
Love and [value] - that's the gift

Happy [holiday], [Name] dear
Full of love throughout the year!

structureTemplate.culturalSensitivity: Include diverse holidays, respect all traditions, teach inclusion

seasonal.scientificBasis: Ritual songs strengthen cultural identity formation (ages 3-6), music enhances holiday memory encoding
